Description: Fragment of flat black-figured pottery plate; plastic ridges on reserved underside. Inside, black-figure animal frieze: haunches of lion to left and body and legs of a large bird to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 225, no. 116)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 113, pl. XXXV, no. 323.9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.803)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4669 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
